One male INGO national staff was attacked and severely beaten by a mob of unknown men in Bukavu. He was left unconscious and his belongings stolen.
One INGO national guard was seriously beaten by a group of intruders who raided the office compound in Gulu.
One national NGO male staff was reportedly killed after being caught in crossfire while harvesting crops from his farm. Reports indicate the gunfire is attributed to disputing clans in the area.

Two INGO national staff members travelling in a vehicle in Amataltal, were ambushed by a mob of unknown men. One staff was injured after the mob tied up both staff, confined them to the car trunk, and drove the vehicle into the desert where the staff were left and the car was stolen.
One INGO national staff driver was reportedly kidnapped in Baraka town. He was released 48 hours later by his unknown abductors.

One female humanitarian worker was reportedly kidnapped along Damaturu - Maiduguri road near Damaturu town, Yobe, by unknown armed perpetrators. Further information on her whereabouts is currently unknown.
One NGO driver was shot and killed while travelling on the Cueibet-Rumbek road in Cueibet County. Official Reports indicate the incident is due to armed intercommunal cattle clashes.

One UN humanitarian agency staff member picked up two unknown individuals while driving between Ramotswa to Otse. The staff member was drugged, blacked out, and woke up on the ground in a field after being robbed.
One national male INGO staff member was assaulted and injured by civilians on the road in Malakal.

Two NGO staff members were reportedly killed after a vehicle-borne IED exploded in the capital Mogadishu. Media reports indicate a polio vaccination campaign group consisting of health workers, humanitarian staff, and government officials was attacked by Al Shabaab militants. The militants first attacked with guns shooting and killing an official and a health worker, before fleeing and triggering the VBIED.

7 INGO national staff were injured after a group of intoxicated youths raided the office compound in Yumbe. The group consisting of approximately 20 perpetrators overpowered the guards, threatened and assaulted the staff, and stole computers/belongings.
Three INGO staff members were ambushed by unknown perpetrators between Pibor and Tangazon, about 8 kms West of Gumuruk. One staff was reportedly shot and killed, with another being seriously injured.
One head of a local NGO and well-known community elder was reportedly shot and killed by Al Shabaab militants in Elasha Biyaha village, Afgooye district.
One NGO staff member in the New Fangak area was shot and killed on route for mission to Korwai by unknown perpetrators.

Two INGO staff members returning from the Mulongwe refugee camp in Fizi county were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed perpetrators. Their driver (not counted here) was released immediately and the remaining 2 staff were released 4 days later.

One NGO staff member was reportedly injured after a vehicle-borne IED exploded as the staff passed by. The IED was placed on a vehicle carrying the district chief, the intended target, and killed the official along with his bodyguard.

Media reports indicate 4 staff members of 2 separate INGOs have been killed in a Tigray region refugee/IDP camp during the month of November. Exact details and dates of the incidents are unknown at this time.
One INGO national male staff member was shot and killed during Tribal clashes in Malakal.

Two male NGO staff members residing in an NGO compound were injured after three unknown perpetrators raided the compound in Kuachlual Payam, Koch County. The staff were robbed and beaten and later received medical attention at the clinic.

Three INGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped while travelling in Abonyoni village, 3 km from Fizi town. Reports indicate the perpetrators were Mayi-Mayi Biolze Bishambuke militants and demanded ransom for the staff members. They were released several days later.
One INGO international male staff member was robbed and injured travelling on his motorcycle in Niamey, while transporting another staff to the airport.

An off-duty INGO driver walking with a group of people from Leer to Koch at 4:00am was ambushed by a group of unknown armed individuals. The staff member was shot and killed by the group for unknown reasons.

Two national NGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped while travelling by boat on the Niger river near Kouakourou, approximately 35 km north of Djenne town, Kewa commune, Djenne cercle, Mopti region. Reports assign unknown extremist militants as likely perpetrators. Further information on their whereabouts is currently unknown.

One INGO national staff member was stabbed in the hand during an attempted kidnapping at his home in Batangafo. Reports indicate Anti-Balaka militants broke into the aid worker's home and tried to abduct him, but were unsuccessful. He was treated at the local hospital and is in stable condition.
One UN contracted driver was assaulted by unknown perpetrators after his truck was ambushed.
One national staff was injured after they were shot in a local market during a retaliation attack. Further information on the motive and perpetrator is unknown.
One national NGO staff member was reportedly shot and killed in Masisi town centre, North Kivu by unknown perpetrators. Further information is unknown at this time.
One Ethiopian Red Cross board member was shot and killed on the street in Adigrat, Tigray.
One Ethiopian Red Cross staff member was shot and killed in Adwa, central Tigray while transporting a pregnant woman to the hospital.

Several aid workers from an INGO were kidnapped by unknown perpetrators while travelling between Ansongo and Goa. They were all released the same day (not counted here) except one national staff which was held until the following day.
One Ethiopian Red Cross volunteer was shot and killed in his home in Hawzen, Tigray.
2 NGO staff members were shot and wounded by unknown gunmen who attacked their vehicle travelling in Seventine village near Dombe.
One INGO staff member was reportedly killed in the Hitsats Refugee Camp. (date is not exact)
One national staff from an INGO was attacked by an unknown militia and had his arm mutilated and amputated in Bwalanda village, Rutshuru.
Three Ethiopian Red Cross volunteers were shot and killed on the street in Aksum, central Tigray.
One humanitarian aid worker along with two government officials returning from Mobbar town were reportedly kidnapped near Wakilti. Further information on their whereabouts is unknown.
One INGO national staff was shot and injured after criminal perpetrators raided a hotel In Kabalo, shot the staff, and robbed the hotel.
One female UN staff member was assaulted after her vehicle was ambushed and robbed.
One male national INGO staff member was injured after being assaulted by another civilian in Dansha, Tigray.
One national staff of an INGO was reportedly kidnapped while travelling near Jakana on the Damaturu-Maiduguri road in Borno. His whereabouts are currently unknown.
One Ethiopian Red Cross driver was shot and killed in Enticho, central Tigray.

One UN staff member was injured after the aid group he was travelling with, in El Fasher North Darfur, was ambushed and attacked by unknown gunmen. The armoured NGO/UN vehicle they were travelling in was taken.
One ICRC guard was shot and wounded when unknown militants raided, robbed, and damaged the office in Bouar.
One off-duty UN staff member was shot and injured after the public transport was ambushed by unknown gunmen in Grimari city.
One Ethiopian Red Cross guard was shot and killed in a road ambush in Adidaero, Tigray.
One male national UN staff member was injured after his private vehicle was ambushed by unknown perpetrators in Majombe, Bujumbura.
One male humanitarian NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped by Boko Haram while traveling from Damaturu to Maiduguri, near Matari village. He was released on June 14.

One marked INGO ambulance transporting patients near Deh village in Mopti, was attacked by a group of unknown armed men. After the ambulance was stopped, the 3 staff on board and the 3 patients were assaulted and detained in the hot sun for several hours before being allowed to continue. During the detention, one patient succumbed to his wounds.
One UN contacted security guard was killed when he was walking beside a road and a vehicle hit an IED in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Two UN contracted staff transporting goods in Mezam, NW Camerooon were shot and killed after being caught in crossfire at a checkpoint between NSAG fighters and security forces.
One female UN humanitarian staff member was attacked and robbed by unknown men while withdrawing money in the Shoprite Shopping Complex in the capital Windhoek.

One male INGO staff member was taken from his home in Wau town by unknown armed perpetrators and held until January 18, 2021. Official reports indicate the perpetrators accused the staff member of adultery, deprived him of food, and assaulted him. He was released as the accusations were found to be false.

One INGO guard was shot and killed by an unknown armed perpetrator while walking near an INGO warehouse in Akobo town. Reports indicate the incident was a revenge killing and not an attack on the INGO.
3 humanitarian staff working in West Darfur were reportedly killed in inter-communal violence according to official statements. Further information is unknown at this time.
One UN national staff was injured after being attacked by an unknown armed group at a project site in Bentiu.
Two NGO male staff members were shot and killed during an ambush while traveling through central Tigray.
One INGO staff member was reportedly shot and injured after being caught in crossfire while travelling from Banyjur in Paltruk Payam towards Lankien.
One UN national humanitarian staff member was assaulted and injured during a dispute with a housing tenant.
One NNGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped while travelling between Gubio and Damasak in Borno. Further information on his whereabouts is currently unknown.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed during an armed incursion into the organisation office in Kilteawlaielo, Eastern Tigray.

An NGO vehicle traveling between Kuerguini and Bentiu bridge was attacked by unknown armed youths. One NGO staff member was killed and another was injured in the leg and received treatment at Bentiu Hospital. The motive for the attack is unverified.

One male UN humanitarian agency national staff was shot and injured after the private vehicle he was travelling in was ambushed on the road near the border between Jonglei and Central Equatoria. Reports indicate 10 unknown armed perpetrators ambushed the vehicle near Malithor village, and injured 2 other civilians as well.
Two INGO staff were killed in a complex attack on a hotel in Mogadishu.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed while travelling in Mekelle, Tigray.
One international UN female staff member was sexually assaulted by an unknown intruder in her home in the capital Bissau.

One INGO staff member was killed during a complex attack on the Afrik Hotel in Mogadishu. Official statements report Al Shabaab militants exploded a car bomb outside the hotel and then stormed the building with guns. 4 other civilians were killed and 10 injured (not counted here).

Two NGO contracted staff members working at a drilling project site in Kuarabiei village, 6km from Yirol town, were attacked and injured by an unknown perpetrator. Both staff members suffered serious injuries to their heads and arms and were treated at the hospital. Initial reports indicate the perpetrator may have been under the influence of alcohol.
One marked INGO ambulance was ambushed and shot at while traveling in Muyuka, Southwest region, by unknown armed men injuring a nurse onboard.

One national male UN humanitarian agency staff member was injured after an unknown criminal broke into his house in the capital, Monrovia. The staff member was able to fight off the intruder, but suffered dislocated fingers and wrist.
One female INGO staff member was sexually assaulted by two colleagues (later dismissed) outside of work in Nairobi.
One male UN staff member was assaulted with a knife by unknown criminals who robbed him on his way to work in Lagos.

A vehicle convoy contracted by an NGO for a polio vaccination campaign was ambushed by unknown armed men on the Maper Road in Rumbek Centre between Apek and Alacok. 4 NGO contractors were shot and killed and 4 others were seriously wounded.
One NNGO staff was reportedly shot and killed by an unknown armed group in Hawzen, Tigray.
One male NGO contracted driver was shot and injured in the Koch town market by unknown perpetrators. Reports indicate the attack is not likely related to his NGO affiliation.

actor1: Sudan People's Liberation Army-in-Opposition (SPLA-IO) affiliated youth
notes: One male NGO staff member was seriously beaten by a group of youths reportedly affiliated with the SPLA-IO. Reports indicate he was near Leka village, 3km from Bunj town retrieving his cows from a grazing area.

A UN aid convoy of 2 vehicles traveling from Goma to Rutshuru approximately 25 km northeast of Goma was ambushed by unknown armed gunmen. The UN driver of one vehicle was killed along with a non UN security personnel and an international diplomat (not counted here).
One humanitarian staff member was reportedly killed in the city of Mbuji-Mayi. Further information is unavailable at this time.
Four INGO male staff members were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed men in Central Mali. Their whereabouts is currently unknown.
One UN humanitarian agency staff member was ambushed and kidnapped while travelling between Bamenda and Kumba near Mamfe. Unknown armed elements held the staff for 3 days.
Two INGO staff members were kidnapped while carrying out humanitarian duties in Dogo town, Mopti, by JNIM militia who accused them of not obtaining authority. The were released 3 days later.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed after an armed incursion into the organisation office in Hawzen, Tigray.
One NGO staff was reportedly kidnapped by Mare-Wagardhac sub-clan militia members in Dhabad village, Galgaduud.
One Red Cross male Ethiopian driver was shot and killed in Samre, Tigray.
One NGO staff member was shot and wounded by an unaffiliated individual over a personal dispute in Thonoum Payam, Unity.
One male NGO staff member was shot and injured after his commercial vehicle was ambushed by unknown gunmen on the road in the vicinity of Gumuruk, while returning to his duty station.
One humanitarian staff member was reportedly killed by a stray bullet during a clash between ISWA militants and the Nigerian Armed Forces.

actor1: Coalition des Patriotes pour le  Changement/Mouvement Patriotique pour la Centrafrique (CPC/MPC)
notes: One INGO staff was reportedly shot and injured by a CPC/MPC militant in Kabo, 58 kms north of Batangafo.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed during an armed incursion of the organisation office in Shire, Tigray.

One INGO male national driver was beaten by Ethiopian Armed Forces after his INGO car was ambushed on the road between Mekele and Adigrat. Official statements report the driver of the INGO car, earlier in the journey, witnessed the extrajudicial killing of 4 men aboard a minibus, and the later ambush by State Forces was related to being a witness to the killings.

One female NGO staff on her way home from duty in the Bentiu PoC site, was stopped by two joint force personnel. The security personnel directed the staff member to remove her trousers due to an alleged dress code for women in the camp. The staff member was assaulted when she refused as the perpetrators attempted to physically remove her trousers with a knife, before bystanders intervened.
Three INGO national staff members, two males and 1 female, were injured after their convoy was ambushed and their vehicles were stolen by an unknown armed group.
One INGO national driver was shot and killed after being ambushed by unknown gunmen in West Wellega.

actor1: Front Populaire pour la Renaissance de Centrafrique (FPRC)
notes: One UN national staff member was assaulted and injured by an armed group in N'dele.
One NGO vehicle driver was ambushed and kidnapped in Taboye, Goa. His whereabouts are unknown.
One UN humanitarian staff was shot in the leg by an unknown gunmen. He was medically evacuated and treated in Khartoum.

actor1: Coalition des Patriotes pour le  Changement/Mouvement Patriotique pour la Centrafrique (CPC/MPC)
notes: One INGO driver was assaulted and pepper-sprayed by CPC rebels after his vehicle was ambushed travelling through Bocaranga city outskirts.
Two NGO staff members were assaulted and wounded between Lonyoro and Longiro, Lafon County, after their vehicle was ambushed by unknown perpetrators.
One NGO staff member was injured after he was assaulted during a robbery in Pibor. He was treated locally.
Two NGO staff were shot and injured after their vehicle was mistakingly shot at in a checkpoint in Mamfe.
Four INGO staff were assaulted and injured after a group of 15-20 youths raided the compound in the Jam Jang humanitarian hub. 1 Staff was airlifted for treatment.
One NGO staff member travelling with his family in a commercial minibus along the Waat-Bor road, was kidnapped and killed when the vehicle was ambushed by unknown perpetrators.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed at the conclusion of a food distribution event in Kola Tembien. Reports indicate the shooting motivation was the alleged food distribution "to the Junta".

One UN staff member was seriously injured after he was assaulted by a mob of community members that raided a project site in Torit. Reports indicated the assault and intrusion occurred following a protest regarding UN/INGO employment bias in the community.
One INGO medical staff was seriously injured after their mobile medical team was ambushed and assaulted by intoxicated soldiers in Karic, on route to Amongpiny.
Two NGO contracted drivers in an aid convoy were seriously injured after they were ambushed and beaten by Murle perpetrators near Gadiang.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed during an armed incursion into the organisation office in Kola Tembien, Tigray.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed in a road ambush in Eastern Tigray.
One female INGO staff was injured near the Landmark Hotel in Juba when an unknown man threw a rock at her, knocking her down. She was treated at a local clinic.
One INGO staff member was injured during a violent compound raid by unknown perpetrators in Renk town.
One INGO Ugandan staff member was reportedly shot and killed after his vehicle was ambushed in the vicinity of Camp 15, Budi.
An INGO community worker was one of 7 civilians killed in a cattle raid in Guech, Kuach Payam.
One INGO nurse was shot and wounded when opposing security forces raided the INGO health facility in Rokero, Central Darfur.
Three INGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped in Fizi Hauts Plateaux during a food distribution project for children. They were released after 3 days due to family negotiations.

Two NGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped 107km northwest of Uvira. One staff was released on May 22 after ransom was paid, and the other staff died while being held on May 20 due to lack of medical treatment.

actor1: Unite pour la paix en Centrafrique (UPC)
notes: Two UN agency staff members were killed after their aid convoy was ambushed by UPC militants 8km outside of Mboki.

admin3: Between Malual Mouk and Tonj South
notes: One UN agency contracted driver was stabbed in the hand after his convoy was ambushed and robbed by suspected Malual Mouk criminals.
One INGO driver and a motorcycle were in a collision on Airport road, Juba. A crowd gathered due to the incident and the driver was assaulted by the mob.
One male INGO doctor was killed in the medical clinic in Ganyiel, Unity.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed during a raid of the office in Gulomekheda, Tigray.
One male aid worker, head of an INGO office in Adigrat, died after being shot in crossfire.
One UN driver was assaulted and injured, when a large group of Monyumiji youth, protesting humanitarian organisation presence in the community, attacked his vehicle.
3 NGO staff were kidnapped near Konna town by JNIM militia.

actor1: Coalition des Patriotes pour le  Changement/Mouvement Patriotique pour la Centrafrique (CPC/MPC)
notes: One INGO staff member was wounded after being assaulted and robbed by CPC militants.
The head of the Red Crescent regional office in Ajdabiya was kidnapped. He was released on February 4, 2022.

Two INGO staff members were killed when their convoy travelling on the Mapourdit-Aluakluak road was ambushed by unknown armed perpetrators. The perpetrators fired on one vehicle, killing both staff, and occupants of the other vehicle were unharmed.
Eight INGO staff, including 3 females, were reportedly abducted in Hourara village from the INGO health centre, Gao.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed walking home in Chukudum, Budi.
One INGO staff member was shot and killed by an unknown attacker at the office compound in Nyal.
Two INGO staff members were shot and injured in a failed kidnapping turned carjacking incident in Zalingi, Central Darfur.
One guard at a humanitarian organisation run primary school was shot and killed when unknown perpetrators raided the school and stole food items and school kits in Machi, Kapoeta South.
At least 3 NGO staff members (exact number unknown) were abducted after being ambushed traveling in Toguere Coumbe commune, Mopti, by JNIM militants. Their whereabouts are unknown.
One UN national staff was harassed and assaulted by security forces in his home in Shire town, Tigray.
Three INGO staff members, two national males and one international female, were killed by unknown assailants while travelling in Tigray.
Two INGO male staff members in a COVID vaccine team were kidnapped by unknown extremists in Kirchamba village in Dire circle.

One INGO staff member was shot and injured during an ambush by Retour, Reclamation et Rehabilitation (3R) combatants. The staff member was transporting a patient on a motorcycle when the attack happened. The female patient passenger was killed.
Three humanitarian workers were kidnapped in Northwest Cameroon while completely a food delivery. They were released 2 days later.

One female international UN staff member was injured by a police officer after she was arrested with a group of people in a restaurant accused of breaking COVID restrictions. They were released 1 hour later.
One NGO staff member was kidnapped travelling 56km NE of Tenekou, Mopti. His whereabouts are unknown.
One NGO staff member was wounded and later died from his injuries in the hospital after being assaulted by a group of individuals in Akobo town. Reports suggest it was over a personal issue.
Three INGO staff were kidnapped in Kumba district. They were released after 2 days.
One UN Congolese staff member transporting livelihood kits to Yirol East county was ambushed and shot by unknown armed perpetrators. He managed to drive to Yirol town for medical attention.
Three national NGO workers were reportedly kidnapped by JNIM militia while traveling between Diallassagou and Bankass. Their whereabouts are currently unknown.
One aid worker, and another civilian, were reportedly shot and killed in Keiyo Valley village by a Pokot militia in a supposed retaliatory attack.
One NGO staff member contracted by a UN agency was shot and wounded by FACA armed forces in Abakar, Kaga-Bandoro for allegedly not compiling with instructions at the checkpoint.
One NGO male staff member was shot and killed while travelling in Mekelle.
One UN national staff was shot and killed by burglars in his home in Bangui.
Two staff members, one female staff from an INGO and one male from a partner NGO, were injured after their group was ambushed and assaulted near Nestiu town, Juba County.
One NGO community health worker was shot and injured by a group of unknown youths between Ngop payam and Cueibet town.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed in a road ambush after leaving the capital Mekelle.
3 national staff of an INGO were reportedly kidnapped by JNIM militia near Kera town Tenenkou, Mopti. Their whereabouts is unknown.
4 INGO staff members were kidnapped by an unknown NSAG travelling 34 km south of Niono near Heremakono in Segou region. They were released with their vehicles the following day.
One INGO staff member was kidnapped along with a teacher and a government official (not counted here) by JNIM Militia while travelling between Matiakoali and Fada Ngourma.
Three aid workers with an HIV testing and counseling program in Benue state were kidnapped and killed by a suspected criminal herder gang in Tomanyi village.
One Togolese Christian NGO aid worker was kidnapped with two other civilians in the town of Bentia, Ansongo by presumed ISWAP militants. Their whereabouts is currently unknown.
Two INGO staff were ambushed and kidnapped by unknown gunmen while travelling near Kanyamahoro, 10km north of Goma on the Goma-Kibumba road. Information on their whereabouts is currently unknown.

Two UN staff members and one INGO staff were injured after a group of refugees temporarily took them hostage at a food distribution project in Yusuf Batil and assaulted them. They received minor medical care.
Two NNGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped in Momo, NW, by an unknown armed group over suspicion they were collecting information for the military. They were released after 6 days.
1 driver was shot and killed in an INGO contracted convoy after it was attacked by unknown gunmen near Aru junction on the Juba-Nimule road.
One NGO staff member was assaulted after he was stopped on his motorcycle and robbed in Ezo county on the Yambio-Tambura road. He was able to reach a nearby medical centre after the attack.
One INGO compound guard was seriously beaten when unknown perpetrators raided the compound in New Fangak. Another guard was able to activate the alarm and nothing was taken before they fled.
One UN agency contracted compound guard was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Bentiu.
One NGO driver was kidnapped by unknown gunmen in the village of Bambara Maoude, Tombouctou.

One NGO staff member was kidnapped during an armed group attack in Nyiragongo that killed 4 civilians and led to 7 other civilian abductions (not counted here). The whereabouts of the staff is presently unknown.
One international ICRC staff was killed in an attack in Bamenda, Northwest.
One UN staff member was badly beaten on his way home from work after running into a gang fight in Dire town.

An unknown number of health workers (entered as NNGO until more information is available) were reportedly abducted from the Lasu Refugee Camp after an unknown armed group raided the camp, stole items from the facility, damaged an ambulance, and abducted other residents.
One national UN staff was assaulted and injured by unknown criminals in Kampala.
One INGO national aid worker was killed during a Boko Haram raid into the military compound in Rann, Borno. 16 other civilians were killed (not counted here).
One NGO staff member was reportedly killed in crossfire during community clashes in Tombura town.

An INGO vehicle on route from Paoua to Bocaranga hit an IED near Koupala, killing the driver and wounding 2 other staff members. Reports indicate the IED was planted by the Retour, Reclamation et Rehabilitation (3R) armed group.

One INGO staff member was kidnapped from the INGO health clinic 38km SW of Bankass by unknown armed elements, for allegedly not informing the group of their presence in the area. The staff was released 5 days later.
One NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped travelling between Fada Ngourma and Kikideni. They were released on September 18 2021.
One UN contracted male daily worker was injured after being assaulted by 6 unknown armed men on his way to work in Bor town.
Three staff members from a UN agency NGO implementing partner were shot and wounded after their aid convoy was ambushed by unknown gunmen near Buhumba village, Nyiragongo.

A UN agency NGO implementing partner aid convoy was ambushed 30km from Yei on the Yei-Kaya road near Ligi, by an unknown armed group. The driver was killed, one staff was injured, and the other 3 were kidnapped. Their whereabouts is unknown.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed during an ambush and motorcycle theft by JNIM militia members in Tila, Bandiagara.
One UN female staff member was injured after an unknown criminal tried to steal her purse while she was riding a motorbike.
One international UN staff member was injured after being assaulted by a UN contractor over payment issues in Malakal.
One INGO security guard was injured after he was assaulted during a criminal raid on a health facility project site in Nyamlel, Aweil West. There was a temporary program suspension.

One international and one national UN contractor was shot and wounded when their UN contracted barge came under fire from unknown gunmen when travelling between Gakdon and Dengjok in Akobo. The barge had just delivered food and was returning from the contracted mission.
A volunteer for an INGO in Pigi county was shot and killed after being caught in fighting between SPLA IO factions.
Four INGO staff members were kidnapped by suspected Mai Mai militia members while travelling 119km south of Uvira, Fizi district. They were freed on October 9.
Two humanitarian staff members were kidnapped in Bouca, Ouham for 2 days.
One INGO staff member was shot and killed in an armed robbery where his motorcycle was stolen in Sevare, Mopti.
Four NGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped in Kingarame, North Kivu.
Two NGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped with their vehicle in Niono, Segou.

One UN national staff member was reportedly ambushed by unknown gunmen along the Juba-Nimule road in Maqwi county. Some reports indicate the staff member managed to escape the attack, but no communication has been received from the staff member.
One NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped in Borno and reports indicate ISWA has taken responsibility.
One INGO male staff was killed in his home in Yei town. Further information is unavailable at this time.
One NGO driver was injured in the thigh and arm after unknown criminals fired shots at the organisation's vehicle leaving the Goudebo refugee camp, 14km outside of Dori.
One male INGO national staff member was shot and killed in Bunia for unknown reasons.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed by a militia member after refusing a food ration card the perpetrator was not entitled to.
Two INGO staff contracted to operate a cash distribution site in Kaya Refugee Camp were assaulted and injured by refugees upset with the speed of the distribution.
Three INGO staff members were kidnapped along with their vehicle in Ganyela, Gourma.

One INGO staff member was shot and injured after an intoxicated man entered a public market area in Lasu refugee camp, begun demanding money and then opened fire. One other civilian (not counted here) was killed.
Two INGO staff members were shot and wounded when their organisation vehicle was ambushed while travelling between Kobu and Bambu, Ituri, by unknown armed individuals for unknown reasons.
One NGO staff member was one of 10 civilians killed in community clashes in Gakdong, Akobo county. Further details are unknown at this time.
One NGO driver was detained for one day after his vehicle was stopped at an SPLO-IO checkpoint in Bagari Payam. The vehicle was not released until November 21.
Two INGO staff and a guard were injured after unknown armed men raided the organisation compound and stole money at gunpoint.
One UN national staff was shot and wounded by Mai Mai militia in Lambo Katenga, Kalemie.

One INGO staff member was injured after the organisation supported health centre in Foube, Sanmatenga was burned down by unknown armed perpetrators. Official reports indicate it was likely collateral damage after the initial attack targeted a nearby police station.
One INGO male staff was shot and injured by a man in a military uniform who robbed him in Adama city.
Two ICRC staff, one national and one international, were kidnapped in Masisi on November 30 by unknown gunmen and released on December 11.
One UN female staff was robbed and stabbed on the hand by an unknown criminal as she was walking to work in Entebbe.

Two private truck staff contracted to deliver humanitarian supplies to Bibokoboko, Fizi, were shot and killed when their truck was ambushed by unknown armed men. 2 other civilian passengers were also killed (not counted here).
One INGO national staff member was killed after being caught in community violence between armed youths and others in Leer.

Humanitarian staff were reportedly kidnapped along with 6 civil servants and other civilians after departing Damboa, Borno. The exact number of humanitarian staff kidnapped is unknown at this time (coded as two).
One NGO staff member was killed after his vehicle was ambushed in Tile village, Mopti.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed and another was wounded by unknown armed criminals after their motorcycle was ambushed in Tranamaro commune.
Three UN agency staff members were wounded after their convoy came under armed attack by suspected Mai Mai militia members while travelling 17km south of Lubero.
One NGO staff member was killed by a family member in an interpersonal dispute in Aweil town.
One UN Agency contracted truck staff was injured when the vehicle hit an IED 78km southwest of Paoua near Ngoutere.
One NGO staff member was killed in a clash between opposing youths in Kong Kong Payam, Jonglei on his way home from work.
One UN agency staff was killed and another injured after their convoy was ambushed by unknown armed men between Duk Padiet and Tindiir, Jonglei.

Three NGO contracted truck staff were reported missing on December 19 and found dead the following day in a forest outside Batangafo. Perpetrators and cause of death is unknown at this time, but their trucks were looted.
One INGO international staff member was kidnapped from his home in Ansongo, Goa. They were released several days later.
One NGO staff member was kidnapped by unknown perpetrators and later released on January 3, 2022.
One INGO national staff member was assaulted and injured by a group of community youths over an age set dispute. The staff was evacuated to Juba for medical treatment.
One female NGO staff was shot and injured in an attempted robbery on her house by unknown criminals in Guolpiny village, Koch.
Three INGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed perpetrators on the Goma-Kitchanga road in Masisi territory. They were released on January 12.
One INGO male staff member was kidnapped in Menaka Gao on January 11, and escaped his captors on January 13.
One UN humanitarian agency staff member driving a vehicle in Mogadishu was injured after a VBIED targeting a nearby convoy exploded.

The president of an NGO was kidnapped while travelling from Abuja to Kaduna near between the villages Akilbu and Rijana. He was reportedly kidnapped and tortured due to his work with some politicians, and released the following week.
5 NGO staff members working bear Oursi town, were kidnapped by ISWA militants. 4 were released later that day (not counted here) and 1 continued to be held. Their whereabouts are unknown.
One INGO staff member was injured when a group of angry commercial motorcyclists threw stones at the INGO vehicle in Katoto centre, Ituri.
Three INGO staff members were kidnapped near Nchowe village, Fizi. Their whereabouts are unknown.
One male NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped by JNIM militia on the road between Fada NGourma and Pama, Gourma.
One off-duty NGO guard was shot and killed in a suspected revenge killing incident between clans as he was repairing his home in Walgak, Akobo.
Two INGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed extremists while travelling between Bandiagara and Sevare, Mopti. There whereabouts is currently unknown.
Three NGO staff members were injured after they were attacked by unknown gunmen on the road near MirMir.
One NGO staff member was reportedly stabbed by suspected gang members in Hai Joppa, Juba city.
One INGO nurse was killed and two other NGO staff injured in inter-communal fighting in Agok, Rumamer county, Abyei.
One NGO staff was killed in crossfire during inter-communal fighting in Mir Mir, Unity.
One NGO staff driver was reportedly shot and killed on his way to the office by unknown perpetrators, some reports indicate it may be related to a personal dispute.
One UN contracted truck driver was ambushed and assaulted by suspected Murle Tribesmen who robbed him, on the Bor-Gadiang road.
One INGO guard was injured after unknown armed perpetrators raided the organisation office in Pembe and stole assorted electronics.
One male NGO staff member was robbed and killed in Uvira at a transfer shop, some reports indicate the staff may have been in debt to the shop but the motive is unknown.
Five INGO staff members were kidnapped from the organisation residence in Fotokol town, Far North region. Their current whereabouts is unknown, as is the motive.
A UN contracted truck hit an IED between Bocaranga and Bozoum injuring one staff and killing another.
Two aid workers were reportedly killed along with 10 other civilians in the Jamina area of West Darfur by armed Rizeigat Militia.
One INGO national staff driver was shot in the leg after his vehicle was ambushed by unknown armed men 15km east of Kapoeta.
One NGO staff member and two guards were kidnapped during a raid of their compound.
Four male nurses and an NGO driver were kidnapped by suspected Mai Mai militia members from a health centre in Katalukulu, Fizi. There whereabouts is unknown.
One off duty NGO staff was reportedly shot and killed in Hiyala, Torit for unknown reasons.
A truck contracted by an NGO to transport materials to Lankien was ambushed by unknown gunmen and one of the foreign national staff was shot and killed.
Three UN agency contracted staff were killed and another staff was injured after their aid convoy was ambushed by unknown armed perpetrators between Gadiang and Yuai in Uror county.

One INGO staff member was killed in suspected intercommunal violence that took place in Leer country during April 8-11.
Two NGO staff members were injured after their convoy was attacked and robbed travelling between Alindao and Bambari, by unknown gunmen.
Three INGO staff were injured after their vehicle was ambushed and robbed on the Batangafo-Ouandago axis.
One UN agency truck driver assistant was beaten with a rifle after his truck was ambushed between Lohutok and Ibahure, Lafon county.

On 26 May 2022, rioters took to the street in Nia-Nia (Bandaka, Mambasa, Ituri), following a rumor that MONUSCO was in the area. The rioters burned a car belonging to Mercy Corps and vandalized a hotel, wounding two ACF employees. Police fired in the air to contain the rioters. No fatalities. [size=no report]

notes: Change to armed group: On 19 December 2020, leaders of the 3 main armed rebel groups occupying large areas of CAR, namely the Anti-Balaka, 3R and MPC, announced a coalition, called the Coalition of Patriots for Change or CPC, ahead of the 27 December elections. The armed groups had decided 'to combine all of our movements into a single entity and under a unified command, and invited 'all other armed groups to join'. The groups accused President Faustin-Archange Touadera's government of seeking to fix upcoming elections and warned of a violent response. The coalition vowed not to attack civilians and to allow vehicles belonging to the United Nations and to humanitarian groups to circulate freely. Location is coded to Bangui (Bangui, Bangui).

notes: End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.
data_source: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); https://www.acleddata.com

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: On 15 November 2018, Anti-Balaka fighters attacked Muslim civilians in the town of Alindao, prompting a reaction from UPC fighters. The UPC, along with members of a local militia calling themselves the Mujahedin, attacked an IDP camp hosting around 20,000 Christians which the Anti-Balaka operated out of. The UPC also brought civilians into the camps during the attacks, but it is unclear if they were used as shields to prevent a reaction from MINUSCA or if the civilians participated in the attack. The Anti-Balaka clashed with the UPC in the camp but ran out of ammunition, at which point UPC forces overran the site. At least 112 people were killed in these incidents (MINUSCA obtained in-depth information on at least 69 victims, while the rest of the names were given by local humanitarian organisations) , with no more precision about the nature of the dead (civilian or combatant) apart from two priests - fatalities split across three distinct events.
data_source: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); https://www.acleddata.com

notes: SPLA-IO forces claimed to have ambushed a government forces' convoy carrying Sudanese rebel JEM fighters under the command of Brig. Gen Abdel Rahman Arbab near Mangayat in Raja, Bahr El Ghazal, killing 35, injuring several others, abducting 15 soldiers and 'rescuing' four humanitarian staffs. JEM later confirmed the death of six of its members on an 'administrative mission' in 'liberated territories' but without specifying the exact circumstances. Local officials claimed that the rebels had ambushed four commercial vehicles in two separate attacks, killing at least eight civilians and abducting six aid workers from HealthNet, Solidarity International and a local aid group (one international and five nationals). The aid workers were released three days later. It is unclear if the two events occurred simultaneously.
source: Radio Tamazuj; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudan Tribune
data_source: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); https://www.acleddata.com
actor2: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition

notes: On 27 and 28 November, Murle youth attacked Dinka civilians in Duk Payuel county. Around 40 civilians killed, over 50 women and children abducted, more than than 1,300 cattle raided, civilian properties and humanitarian food items looted and burnt down. Among the casualties, six people working for NGOs were killed (including five from WFP cooperating partners) and another three aid workers injured. A joint force of the army, police and security was deployed and the abducted people were recovered a few days later.
source: Gurtong Trust; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; UNMISS; UNSC; Eye Radio (South Sudan); UNOCHA
data_source: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); https://www.acleddata.com
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (South Sudan); Bor Clan Militia (South Sudan)

A humanitarian worker from the South Kordofan and Blue Nile Coordination Unit appeared to have been one of the victims. There is no clear motive for the attack, which follows an accusation by the Malik Agar faction that forces loyal to Joseph Touka (the deputy of Abdelaziz al-Hilu) were responsible for killing over 50 ethnic Ingessana in same area on 9 June. The ethnic identity of the victims in this attack is not specified.

notes: Reports of government offensives on SPLA-IO positions in and around Mathiang in Longochuk County, Upper Nile, from around 1-6 July. On 6 July, SPLA-IO claimed to have repulsed pro-government attacks on their positions in Mangok, Mathiang, Malou, Biot and Guel Guk, inflicting 74 fatalities and dozens of injuries. Meanwhile, government troops claimed to have captured Marial and Thoc areas in Longochuk, losing five soldiers and 21 others wounded. Thousands of people were displaced and dozens of aid workers forced to relocate from Longochuk and Maiwut counties as tensions escalated around 6-7 July. Humanitarian compounds in Mathiang were reportedly looted during the fighting. SPLA denied any clashes in the area.
source: UNOCHA; Sudan Tribune; South Sudan News Agency
data_source: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED); https://www.acleddata.com

notes: Clashes between SPLA-IO and Mathiang Anyoor militia in Matot, Pieri, Pulchuol, Waat and Walgak areas of Jonglei on 15 April. State forces reportedly recaptured Waat after two days of fighting on 15-16 April. In Waat, rebels claimed that government forces dropped poisonous gas from helicopters during the attack, targeting rebel positions, leaving several people injured. Civilians who fled the area alleged initial indiscriminate shelling and shooting by government forces and cross-fire from opposition forces, causing deaths of civilians. Property was also looted and destroyed during the fighting. Humanitarian workers were forced to evacuate the area.
source: South Sudan News Agency; UNOCHA; Sudan Tribune; Protection Cluster; UNHCR; ECHO; UNSC

notes: On 10 April 2017, SPLA forces supported by Dinka militiamen conducted early morning house-to-house searches in Wau (Aweil Jedid, Nazareth, Hai Kosti and Bagari residential areas) following fighting with rebels the day before, particularly targeting Lou and Fertit tribesmen. Between 24-29 deaths were reported to the police, as confirmed in a later report by the UN Human Rights Commission on South Sudan, while more than 22,000 people were forced to flee. Authorities imposed a curfew on the town. 2 national WFP staff were also arrested and detained by NSS personnel on that day.
